intro: Kegeliella houtteana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Kegeliella houtteana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
